name: Arrowhead Plant
description: Syngonium podophyllum 'Batik', commonly known as Arrowhead Plant, is an epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. It belongs to the Araceae family and features climbing or trailing stems (60-300 cm long) with large, dramatic, arrow-shaped to deeply lobed, dark green leaves with distinctive white variegation patterns. The plant displays a climbing/trailing growth habit. Known as "arrowhead plant" for its juvenile arrow-shaped leaves that develop into deeply lobed adult leaves. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds dynamic visual interest with leaves that change shape dramatically as the plant matures. It's popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its attractive variegated foliage.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
